title_sort: thomas jefferson whitman to louisa van velsor whitman, 5 february 1873
title: Thomas Jefferson Whitman to Louisa Van Velsor Whitman, 5 February 1873
text: St. Louis,Feb 5th 1873Dear MotherI write to say that Mattie is very sick—that although yet hopeful—I fear very much that in some of the paroxisms[paroxysms] of coughing she may become so weak that she will not rally again—most of the time she continues cheerful and good—but at times her sufferings are too much for her to bear—as good as she always has been about such thingsOf course we will all hope and pray for the best—yet you must not be surprised to hear that it is all over with the dear soul at any time—I have written to Walt—I wish Walt would come and see her—do you not think he would—Love to allaffectionately Jeff Thomas Jefferson Whitman to Louisa Van Velsor Whitman, 5 February 1873
